collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. title: Ronald E. Pitts. St. Louis?

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.

It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

terms_of_use: The images on this site are from material in the collections of the McCormick Library of Special Collections and University Archives of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only. title: March 5, 1981

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

title: Ronald E. Pitts. St. Louis?

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

title: December 10, 1971

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. title: Pine Bluff, Arkansas

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.

It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

title: Northwestern Community Ensemble

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. project.name: The Absence of Music, Northwestern Community Ensemble 50th Anniversary

series: Northwestern Community Ensemble--50th Anniversary Collection
description:
In 1971, a group of Black students came together on the Northwestern University campus to form a choir called the Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) in the Black sacred music tradition. The group provided a spiritual outlet and a space to connect at a predominately white university and engage in a Black cultural tradition. For the past 50 years, this music ministry still has a strong presence on campus and has impacted the greater Chicago area. In this documentary, the founders and early members tell the origin story. They also recall some of their favorite memories from their time in the choir. 

The documentary premiered at the "NCE 50th Anniversary Concert: Legacy of Praise," on May 8, 2021.

title: December 10, 1971

collection.description: The Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE) is a student choral group established in the Black Christian music tradition. It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.

It was founded on May 8, 1971, to provide Northwestern students with a spiritual outlet, as well as a venue to sing Black sacred music and foster community. The photographs in this collection span the 1970s to the 1980s. They depict the choir in rehearsals, concerts, and tours.
collection.title: Northwestern Community Ensemble (NCE)

terms_of_use: The images on this site are from material in the collections of the McCormick Library of Special Collections and University Archives of Northwestern University Libraries, are provided for use by its students, faculty and staff, and by other researchers visiting this site, for research consultation and scholarly purposes only.
